intro: Azalea teysmannii, commonly known as the Teyssmann azalea, is a species native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in the Philippines and Indonesia. It is a flowering shrub characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant belongs to the Rhododendron genus and is part of the Ericaceae family, which includes many ornamental and evergreen plants. Azalea teysmannii typically blooms in spring or early summer, producing vibrant pink to red flowers that attract pollinators. It prefers acidic, well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight, making it a popular choice for gardens in tropical and subtropical climates.
